alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 21 at 7:20PM CDT until September 21 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Nebraska, including the following county, Red Willow. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 718 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms has allowed flooding to occur. Reports of streets in McCook flooded along with some basements. Barnet Park is closed as well. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. DO NOT DRIVE AROUND FLOODED AREAS UNTIL FLOODING HAS RECEDED. - This includes the following streams and drainages... West Kelley Creek, Brushy Creek, Dry Creek, Drainage to Republican Rvr and Republican River. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McCook. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
